reviews.content: Very poor communication and service support. No instructions came with product. Missing parts (no pedals). None of these issues are listed in the item description. I would not have purchased it had I known it wouldn’t come with assembly instructions or an operators manual. I certainly would not have purchased it had I known it would be missing basic parts needed for operation. Customer service failed to do anything they said they had done. I gave a corrected phone number to them for the shipping company to use and twice was told that Wahoo had updated the BOL. They had not done so, resulting in my delivery being a week late. Overall, I would no recommend this product or Wahoo as a company.
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTMENT AWAITS

reviews.content:
I should start saying I love the bike. However, after a few use I already have issues. Bluetooth drops. I have 5 rides in 6 days. First ride I experienced a drop of Bluetooth signal after an hour. So I changed computers for the second ride (100 miles) no drops. Third ride (30mi) no drops. Fourth ride ERG mode work out drop at 30mi. Fifth ride drops after half hour. Next time I will try ANt+ but it is annoying.
One of the clamp on top tube does not go all the way back in but I am ok with since it does not touch my leg.
There is some wiggle with the handlebar no matter how tight or what tight pattern I use to tighten the stem.
Since I can feel the wiggle when I sprint only I am sort of ok with it, but I am worried about the lifetime of the handlebar.
Worse is the whistle noise when the bike shift to higher gear or resistance. The bike is overall quiet but when on Zwift with grade change it sounds like someone run his finger on the edge of a glass half full of water.
All in all I am annoyed by these details and wondering if I should just return it or get customer service involved.
reviews.title: Love it but many (small?) issues

reviews.content: I like this bike and it definitely makes riding Zwift more fun. It is stable and very responsive to gear shifts. However, I am incredibly frustrated by the shockingly poor quality of the quick release levers. On almost every ride, the seat post AND handlebars will gradually slide down, which has led to workout interruptions and knee pain. It is almost impossible to get enough leverage on the levers, even after using carbon paste. I had hoped to be able to swap the setup so my daughter could use the bike as well, but now I'm too worried about maintaining my setup. A real shame as the rest of the bike is great. I can't recommend the V1 version of this bike.

reviews.content:
The good: 
- Easy to assemble.
- The technology is unparalleled. Riding on Zwift is close to riding IRL due to the tilt and flywheel technology. This is not a spin or exercise bike. It’s a cycling trainer in a category of its own.


The bad: 
- The production and quality of the bike is complete junk. 
- The handlebars feel cheap to the touch.
- The seat post was initially slipping until Wahoo sent out a replacement post. 
- The bike makes all sorts of creaking, popping and resonance sounds when riding. 
- There’s a grinding belt sound and feeling through the bike and pedals. It’s not smooth at all.

For the money I paid, there should be zero issues, the bike should not feel cheap and it should be whisper quiet and smooth.

If you’re looking for the best technology available and don’t mind buying junk quality then I highly recommend. I would do it over again, but say shame on Wahoo for selling such junk.
reviews.title: Nice Tech but Terrible Quality

Lots of feedback through the pedals/cranks which at points can feel uncomfortable. 

Build quality is below my expectation for a product that is worth this much money. The bike isn’t secure and has wobbles in the handlebars and main frame.

reviews.content:
On the plus side, the build was easy and well explained. The adjustments to switch between riders is quick and easy. The bike looks good and it is a positive point too. 
On the negative side, the quality is not quite there on 2 points: the seat post and the head tube don’t fit properly in their tubes and the looking mechanisms don’t lock them in place. 
I managed to sort out the seat post but my partner struggle to unlock it as it has to be really tight. The handlebar on the other hand is not fixed. It keeps sliding down as we are ide and the position is then changed. Not nice at all! I will have to look at how to fix it probably using packers or shims. Doesn’t help in the workouts…
reviews.title: Room for improvement

reviews.content: I thought it would be life changing and it really isn’t. A standard Kickr is just as good. I was expecting silent trouble free and it’s quiet but not silent and the seat post and bar step slippage are not what I was expecting. It is incredibly smooth though. So smooth it is not really realistic. The top tube is really quite wide and both of my legs rub. It first it was just a little annoying but it now it’s more than just an annoyance. The set up app was absolutely worthless. A tape measure was much more accurate. If you have too much money it’s an okay purchase but you are probably better off with just a standard Kickr.

reviews.content:
Bike is okay. Saddle is beyond awful. Purchasing/0rdering experience beyond horrible! The site wasn't working properly when i attempted to purchase. The order was showing completed after going through all the steps. It was not going through to transaction complete. I hit the final purchase button one more time and still no verification of purchase. I checked my credit card transactions and it shows that i tried to buy 2 bikes and therefore the transaction declined due to insufficient funds. When i opened the Wahoo site on my phone the next morning the purchase details were still on the site with all the details and final price. I hit the complete order button and this time it worked. Unfortunately Wahoo charged more than was displayed on the final pricing. I tried to deal with this through Wahoo support. Very polite but no resolution. 
Cost me more than the agreed pricing and a lot of time and effort trying to get it resolved. I would have thought that Wahoo would take responsibility for their site not working.

reviews.content: I am still experiencing issues with the ascending button and the support from your staff regarding a warranty return is poor. I have received the return boxes and I am still awaiting a response from Gavin regarding how this will happen. Not happy to be honest and I am at the point of considering making a formal compliant
reviews.title: Customer Support

reviews.content:
I ordered my KICKR Bike direct from Wahoo, it was delivered as promised just before Christmas and was fairly easy to assemble and get started but I’ve had a number of quality problems after just one week:

1) the saddle quick release bolt has snapped
2) the inertia wheel squeaks and vibrates noisily at certain speeds
3) two of the leg bolts are jammed and won’t tighten any further 

To be fair to Wahoo I haven’t given them an opportunity to address the issues yet and the bike seems to integrate very well with Zwift via Apple TV and looks great in the house, unlike most trainers or road bike trainer set-ups.
reviews.title: Well designed smart trainer with quality issues

bolt.sentence:

To be fair to Wahoo I haven’t given them an opportunity to address the issues yet and the bike seems to integrate very well with Zwift via Apple TV and looks great in the house, unlike most trainers or road bike trainer set-ups.

reviews.content: I love the technology that the Kickr Bike offers, but the bike itself just isn't very substantial at all. When climbing a hill, and I need to get out of the saddle and stand up, I hesitate because I feel like the bike might fall apart. It rattles and sways when I get out of the saddle and I'm not a big person at all. Initially I wondered if it wasn't assembled correctly, but realized its just the bike. I am rather disappointed in the quality...especially because I paid $3500. for it.
reviews.title: Kickr Bike

reviews.content:
Do not buy a kickr bike unless you have a) professional bike fit numbers to plug in, or b) the ability to get a bike fit house call. Wahoo's fitting guide is useless and there is no support for fitting. I feel like I've just spent a pile of money on a tool that is actually hurting me because I don't have access to the fitting tools I need. 
Also, as a refurbished product, it arrived with a broken part and without having a known issue fixed. Caveat emptor.
reviews.title: Good bike, beware of fitting challenges

reviews.content: Before I went through my list of problems, new was being advertised for the price of refurbished. My refurbished unit had dog hair packed in the roller wheels. The roller wheels were worn down as if it had been wheeled around for miles. The rest of the bike looked ok. The left shifter cable had a short, support sent me new handle bars. PM work says to tighten screws to reduce vibration, 1 screw was gone and 1 screw was stripped out in the bottom of the drivetrain case. It has more noise and vibration than I'd like. The cranks are very hard to turn by hand even freewheeling backward, you can feel the notches on the belt drive. It felt like a used piece of exercise equipment, not refurbished. It works.
reviews.title: Impression is used, not refurbished.

reviews.content: My father and I both bought these bikes. Both of ours broke in the first week. His was the bike clamp, mine was the handle bar / shifting assembly. I had to give support the same information over and over for them to finally send me a repair.
reviews.title: Bad quality for the money

repaired.name: repaired
repaired.sentence: I had to give support the same information over and over for them to finally send me a repair.

reviews.content:
Really enjoying the bike so far, the setup was easy and connecting to Zwift was simple (using apple TV). The ordering & delivery process however was horrible. No information from the company, even when the bike shipped. I opened multiple support tickets to get some sort of status after a few weeks with no communication from the company. It wasn't until I sent a terse email that I was provided with a tracking number, shipping company, phone number and dates.. not sure why that cant be provided automatically through email or website rather than thinking my bike is sitting in the ether where nobody knows what happened to it. Once I had this information, I had to do all the investigative work to reach out and get it delivered.. all of the information that the delivery company had was wrong (5 digit phone number??, wrong address??) It's all input correctly into the order and account on the website, so someone is manually typing into an ordering portal somewhere.

Frustrating that I had to unwind this mess myself, Wahoo just kept telling me to wait a few more weeks.. it would have never showed up because all of the information the shipping company had was wrong.

On niche products, customer support is usually a priority, not for this company apparently.
reviews.title: Frustrating order process

delivery.sentence: The ordering and delivery process however was horrible.

reviews.content: I ordered the bike on 28 Nov 2022; it was initially delivered to a City I do not reside in and is 500 miles from my home. I received the bike on 21 Dec, not even close to the seven-day shipping promise. Next, the bike was defective; the right shifter would not work. After foolish troubleshooting, I was shipping a new handlebar assembly, 2nd day Air FedEx, on the 27th; it arrived at the FedEx shipping point in Kennesaw, GA, on the 29th. That means it took 2 days to get 50 miles. No, at the time of review, I have not used the bike because it is not operational still. I suspect Wahoo does nothing in the form of serviceability checks on the devices before they are shipped. Experience + Support = Disaster.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience

bike.sentence: Next, the bike was defective; the right shifter would not work.

I bought this product and it is a certified reconditioned kickr Bike.
It's making noices and it sounds like the belt.
After a few races in Zwift, the noices get louder. I think I need some help there.

reviews.content: When I received my bike and finished the setup I was ready to ride. I climbed on and the bike went full forward almost throwing me over the bars. Pretty scary first experience. This was a Certified Recondition Kickr bike and I expected it to be inspected before it was sold. The next problem is the way they run customer service. The people I corresponded were cordial and knowledgeable. The problem is that it took over a week, Oct 31 to Nov 11 to get a replacement bike on the way. This problem could have been handled in a few minutes with a phone call but Wahoo insists on email communication which absolutely sucks. Email and wait for a response, repeat for days. Love the replacement bike but I hope I don't have to use customer service again.
reviews.title: KICKR Bike

use.name: use

reviews.content: The Bike is great and very sturdy with the exception of the Handlebars. They do not stay in their position so when you lean on them during a cycle they often slip down which is concerning. I have contacted support and I am hoping for a soluiton but a quick look on google for the issue and it appears that many who have the bike experience this issue. Given the price I do not expect these types of issues to be common. It seems like a basic requirement to ensure the handlebars remain steady.
reviews.title: So much to be pleased about but one major flaw

reviews.content: I received this a week ago. It has been very difficult to fit this bike. I have been following the app, and took the picture of my Trek bike for fitting. It was way off. I tried this several times. I am also having a lot of trouble syncing the bike to my phone. So fat I am very disappointed in such an expensive piece of exercise equipment. I have not been able to work out yet.

reviews.content: Lots of nice features, but a few are poorly implemented leading to a so-so experience. The biggest problem is the grade adjustment mechanism which seems cool, but it has slop in the joints so the bike tips back and forth while pedaling. The next issue is the buttons on the handlebars. Its impossible not to press these all the time.

reviews.content: Arrived not working properly. Not sure who does the “reconditioning” but looks like was just sent out untested. Tilt not working. Tried all the advice on wahoo fitness, Facebook, Zwift, and anything else I can find online. Still doesn’t work. Customer service closed for holidays.
reviews.title: Buy new not “reconditioned”

reviews.content: Love the bike but unfortunately had to be returned due a noise and some friction. Now waiting on replacement as besides that it was a joy. Nonetheless not great that a refurbished unit is shipped with obvious flaws. Hoping replacement (when received) will work properly.

reviews.content:
Reconditioned came with zero info or manuals. The app is ok as a guide but had to google to get the full understanding. 

Some of the buttons don’t work and the tilt function isn’t following Zwift terrain despite being unlocked. With several friends already on their 2nd and 3rd unit my expectations are not high as it seems Wahoo do not test thoroughly enough before going to market. 

I love wahoo stuff but they do have quality control issues for sure
reviews.title: Not too sure if this es sa smart buy

reviews.content:
I so want this to be the ultimate indoor trainer but it falls short - in some places far short.

Most obviously this is noticeable in the little things. The handlebar stem clamp is badly designed and the bars loosen easily during normal use. The flywheel is quiet except for a loud resonance effect at 75-85rpm which is a normal cadence for most people. The top tube is wide which means that your thighs rub intermittently.

All of these issues can be lived with although they are not great when you're paying £3000. Unfortunately I've hit a problem where the flywheel gets stuck in its highest resistance setting and almost nothing fixes the issue - apart from leaving the bike unplugged for 24 hours. 

Clearly this failure makes the bike unusable which is a shame as I'd love for the Kickr Bike to be perfect.
reviews.title: Wait for version 2

reviews.content: Very well made and packaged. Easy to put together, but needed to work on getting my fit right. Was very excited to get going. Had a couple of shake down rides and the elevation is great the cockpit configuration amazing. However the magnetic flywheel was a let down for me. It resonated a lot and sometimes felt like an uneven power output on the erg. 8 rides after to be sure, I gave my Wahoo Kickr a go and loved it once more. Regretfully sending back. Have to say that Wahoo support was great. Look forward to returning to the product in the future.
reviews.title: So wanted to like it, sadly returning.

reviews.content: It's surprising that Wahoo sells such a fine bicycle trainer yet provides Customer Support so lacking. With simply prompt response to questions regarding the bike's set-up, an App that isn't working properly, and the attention given to a client that comes with purchasing their $3500 marquis product I'd easily have rated the transaction 5 Stars.
reviews.title: Not happy at this point

reviews.content: This is my third dedicated indoor spin bike and by FAR my most expensive (and disappointing). This is my first "smart bike" and the reason why I "upgraded" from my other spin bikes. My prior spin bike is a Cycleops 300 Pro and I purchased the Wahoo because I wanted to be able to fully integrate with Zwift, Sufferfest, and Rouvy. The overall smart features re: integrating and pairing with these third party apps has worked as expected and pairing is easy. This is the only upgrade over my other spin bikes that were 1 quarter of the cost. The overall comfort of the bike has been disappointing, having to change out the saddle, handlebars and stem to get a comfortable fit (even using the special features on the Wahoo app was not helpful and I found it weird that I couldn't replicate a comfortable fit that the cheaper bikes had). The bike is not "virtually silent", but not incredibly loud either. It's about as loud as a microwave, but beware of the high pitched squeels that you will get at different cadences and speeds. Also disappointing that there's nowhere to put a tablet or phone, or anything for that matter (so you will need to spend even more money if you want to have a place to put your tablet, phone, towel, etc). There is 1 USB charging port but again, what's the point when there's nowhere to put whatever you are charging. Lastly, there seems to be a learning curve to dialing in the shifting as well. The actual "feel" of the shift on the levers is realistic, but don't expect to be able to hold a consistent power or cadence during shifting, like on an outdoor bike. Stability is also lacking, meaning I probably won't tip the bike over, but it sure feels like it when standing or sprint (keep in mind that I'm a 5'6 female who hardly generates loads of power). And lastly, the "thigh rub" issue that others have mentioned, meaning my thighs rub on the frame when riding. I am really wanting to like this bike but am currently finding it impossible to justify the cost of the upgrade over my other spin bikes (which were better in every way but would not fully integrate into the Sufferfest).
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.content: Using the Trainer Road app in "resistance mode" I started in 1st gear and shifted up 1 gear every minute holding a relatively constant cadence of ~80 RPM, and there is no change in power for the first 3 shifts. I then double shifted to 5th gear and got small bump in power. Each successive shift results in huge spikes in power, followed by a lot of ~5-10% undulations in power until it finally settles in after about 30 seconds. On the way back down, you get the inverse experience. This bike has great potential, but currently fails in anything other than ERG mode training--which in my opinion is a sub-optimal way to train, given that is not how the real world works.
reviews.title: Kinks need to be worked out

reviews.content: I've been riding this since Christmas, it doesn't work as well as my tacx neo despite being 2x the price. The build quality is nice, but the software is incredibly lacking, maybe they'll fix it eventually in firmware, but who knows. I'd save the money, but a cheaper trainer and then a nice carbon road bike with what you have left over.
reviews.title: Overpriced, doesn't outperform cheaper trainers
